items.name: Component_LayoutSceneBehavior
items.content:
# =================================================================== # # Script: Component_LayoutSceneBehaviorã€€ # # $$COPYRIGHT$$ # # =================================================================== class Component_LayoutSceneBehavior extends gs.Component_SceneBehavior # @objectCodecBlackList = ["objectManager"] ###* * The base class of all scene-behavior components. A scene-behavior component * define the logic of a single game scene. * * @module gs * @class Component_LayoutSceneBehavior * @extends gs.Component_SceneBehavior * @memberof gs ### constructor: -> super() @objectManager = SceneManager @layout = null @resourceContext = null ###* * Initializes the scene. * * @method initialize ### initialize: -> super @resourceContext = ResourceManager.createContext() ResourceManager.context = @resourceContext if not @object.layoutData? @object.layoutData = { "type": "ui.FreeLayout", "controls": [], "frame": [0, 0, 1, 1] } LanguageManager.loadBundles() ###* * Disposes the scene. * * @method dispose ### dispose: -> super ###* * Prepares all data for the scene and loads the necessary graphic and audio resources. * * @method prepareData * @abstract ### prepareData: -> gs.ObjectManager.current = @objectManager if not GameManager.initialized GameManager.initialize() @dataFields = ui.UiFactory.dataSources[@object.layoutData.dataSource || "default"]() window.$dataFields = @dataFields @music = ui.Component_FormulaHandler.fieldValue(@object, @object.layoutData.music) AudioManager.loadMusic(@music) @prepareTransition(RecordManager.system.menuTransition) ResourceLoader.loadUiTypesGraphics(ui.UiFactory.customTypes) ResourceLoader.loadUiLayoutGraphics(@object.layoutData) if @dataFields? ResourceLoader.loadUiDataFieldsGraphics(@dataFields) ResourceManager.getBitmap("Graphics/Characters/JaneDate_Normal") ###* * Prepares all visual game object for the scene. * * @method prepareVisual ### prepareVisual: -> scale = Graphics.scale vocab = RecordManager.vocabulary if not @layout? @dataObject = {} @layout = ui.UiFactory.createFromDescriptor(@object.layoutData, @object) if @music? AudioManager.changeMusic(@music, 30) @layout.ui.prepare() @layout.ui.appear() @layout.update() @transition() if SceneManager.previousScenes.length == 0 if GameManager.tempFields.isExitingGame GameManager.tempFields.isExitingGame = no gs.GameNotifier.postResetSceneChange(@object.layoutName) else gs.GameNotifier.postSceneChange(@object.layoutName) ###* * Updates the scene's content. * * @method updateContent ### updateContent: -> GameManager.update() Graphics.viewport.update() ###* * Shows/Hides the current scene. A hidden scene is no longer shown and executed * but all objects and data is still there and be shown again anytime. * * @method show * @param {boolean} visible - Indicates if the scene should be shown or hidden. ### show: (visible) -> if visible ResourceManager.context = @resourceContext @layout.visible = visible @layout.update() @objectManager.active = visible if visible gs.ObjectManager.current = SceneManager #@objectManager #@objectManager.update() ###* * Action method which triggers a full refresh on the object returned by the specified binding-expression. * The params must be a direct binding-expression string. * * @method fullRefreshObject * @param {gs.Object_Base} sender - The sender object. * @param {string} params - The binding expression. ### fullRefreshObject: (sender, object) -> object = ui.Component_FormulaHandler.fieldValue(sender, object) object?.fullRefresh() ###* * Action method which triggers a refresh on the object returned by the specified binding-expression. * The params must be a direct binding-expression string. * * @method refreshObject * @param {gs.Object_Base} sender - The sender object. * @param {string} params - The binding expression. ### refreshObject: (sender, object) -> object = ui.Component_FormulaHandler.fieldValue(sender, object) object?.needsUpdate = true addStyle: (sender, style) -> styleObject = ui.UIManager.styles[style] styleObject?.apply(sender) sender.needsUpdate = yes if styleObject?.font sender.behavior.refresh() removeStyle: (sender, style) -> styleObject = ui.UIManager.styles[style] styleObject?.revert(sender) sender.descriptor.styles.remove(style) for s in sender.descriptor.styles ui.UIManager.styles[s]?.apply(sender) sender.needsUpdate = yes if styleObject?.font sender.behavior.refresh() ###* * Action method which executes the specified bindings. * * @method executeBindings * @param {gs.Object_Base} sender - The sender object. * @param {Object[]} params - An array of binding-definitions. ### executeBindings: (sender, bindings) -> for binding in bindings ui.Component_FormulaHandler.executeBinding(sender, binding) return null ###* * Action method which executes the specified formulas. * * @method executeFormulas * @param {gs.Object_Base} sender - The sender object. * @param {ui.Formula[]} params - An array of formula-definitions. ### executeFormulas: (sender, formulas) -> for formula in formulas ui.Component_FormulaHandler.executeFormula(sender, formula) ###* * Action method which executes an animation on a specified target game object. * * @method executeAnimation * @param {gs.Object_Base} sender - The sender object. * @param {Object} params - Contains target-id and animations: { target, animations } ### executeAnimation: (sender, params) -> object = ui.Component_FormulaHandler.fieldValue(sender, params.target) animation = object?.animations.first (a) -> a.event == params.event if animation and object object.animationExecutor.execute(animation) ###* * Action method which emits the specified event. * * @method emitEvent * @param {gs.Object_Base} sender - The sender object. * @param {Object} params - Contains event name, source and data. *
    *
  • params.name - The name of the event to emit
    • *
  • params.source - A binding-expression to define the game object which should emit the event.
    • *
  • params.data - An object containing additional event specific data.
    • *
### emitEvent: (sender, params) -> object = ui.Component_FormulaHandler.fieldValue(sender, params.source) object?.events.emit(params.name, object, ui.Component_FormulaHandler.fieldValue(sender, params.data)) ###* * Action method which changes the game's aspect ratio. * * @method executeBindings * @param {gs.Object_Base} sender - The sender object. * @param {boolean} params - If true the game screen will stretched so that it fills the entire screen * of the player without any black borders. Otherwise the game screen stretches but keeps its ratio * so black borders are possible if the game resolution's ratio and the target display's ratio are not match. It can also * be a binding-expression. ### adjustAspectRatio: (sender, adjust) -> adjust = ui.Component_FormulaHandler.fieldValue(sender, adjust) GameManager.settings.adjustAspectRatio = adjust Graphics.keepRatio = !adjust Graphics.onResize() ###* * Action method which enters fullscreen mode. * * @method enterFullScreen * @param {gs.Object_Base} sender - The sender object. * @param {boolean} params - Can be null ### enterFullScreen: (sender, params) -> gs.Graphics.enterFullscreen() GameManager.settings.fullScreen = Graphics.isFullscreen() ###* * Action method which leaves fullscreen mode. * * @method leaveFullScreen * @param {gs.Object_Base} sender - The sender object. * @param {boolean} params - Can be null ### leaveFullScreen: -> gs.Graphics.leaveFullscreen() GameManager.settings.fullScreen = Graphics.isFullscreen() ###* * Action method which toggles between window and fullscreen mode. * * @method toggleFullScreen * @param {gs.Object_Base} sender - The sender object. * @param {boolean|string} params - Can be null ### toggleFullScreen: (sender, params) -> if gs.Graphics.isFullscreen() gs.Graphics.leaveFullscreen() else gs.Graphics.enterFullscreen() GameManager.settings.fullScreen = gs.Graphics.isFullscreen() ###* * Action method which plays the specified sound. * * @method playSound * @param {gs.Object_Base} sender - The sender object. * @param {Object} params - The sound to play. ### playSound: (sender, params) -> AudioManager.loadSound(params) AudioManager.playSound(params) ###* * Action method which plays the specified voice. * * @method playVoice * @param {gs.Object_Base} sender - The sender object. * @param {Object} params - The voice to play. ### playVoice: (sender, params) -> AudioManager.loadSound(params) AudioManager.playVoice(params) ###* * Action method which turns voice on or off. * * @method turnOnOffVoice * @param {gs.Object_Base} sender - The sender object. * @param {boolean|string} params - If true voice will be turned on. Otherwise it will be turned off. Can also be a binding-expression. ### turnOnOffVoice: (sender, state) -> if ui.Component_FormulaHandler.fieldValue(sender, state) then @turnOnVoice() else @turnOffVoice() ###* * Action method which turns music on or off. * * @method turnOnOffMusic * @param {gs.Object_Base} sender - The sender object. * @param {boolean|string} params - If true music will be turned on. Otherwise it will be turned off. Can also be a binding-expression. ### turnOnOffMusic: (sender, state) -> if ui.Component_FormulaHandler.fieldValue(sender, state) then @turnOnMusic() else @turnOffMusic() ###* * Action method which turns sound on or off. * * @method turnOnOffSound * @param {gs.Object_Base} sender - The sender object. * @param {boolean|string} params - If true sound will be turned on. Otherwise it will be turned off. Can also be a binding-expression. ### turnOnOffSound: (sender, state) -> if ui.Component_FormulaHandler.fieldValue(sender, state) then @turnOnSound() else @turnOffSound() ###* * Action method which turns off voice. * * @method turnOffVoice * @param {gs.Object_Base} sender - The sender object. * @param {boolean|string} params - Can be null. ### turnOffVoice: -> AudioManager.stopAllVoices() ###* * Action method which turns off music. * * @method turnOffMusic * @param {gs.Object_Base} sender - The sender object. * @param {boolean|string} params - Can be null. ### turnOffMusic: -> AudioManager.stopMusic() ###* * Action method which turns off sound. * * @method turnOffSound * @param {gs.Object_Base} sender - The sender object. * @param {boolean|string} params - Can be null. ### turnOffSound: -> AudioManager.stopAllSounds() ###* * Action method which turns on voice. * * @method turnOnVoice * @param {gs.Object_Base} sender - The sender object. * @param {boolean|string} params - Can be null. ### turnOnVoice: -> ###* * Action method which turns on sound. * * @method turnOnSound * @param {gs.Object_Base} sender - The sender object. * @param {boolean|string} params - Can be null. ### turnOnSound: -> ###* * Action method which turns on music. * * @method turnOnMusic * @param {gs.Object_Base} sender - The sender object. * @param {boolean|string} params - Can be null. ### turnOnMusic: -> AudioManager.resumeMusic() ###* * Action method which selects the specified language. * * @method selectLanguage * @param {gs.Object_Base} sender - The sender object. * @param {number|string} params - Index of the language to set. Can be a binding-expression. ### selectLanguage: (sender, params)-> language = LanguageManager.languages[ui.Component_FormulaHandler.fieldValue(sender, params)] LanguageManager.selectLanguage(language) ###* * Action method which resets global data storage. * * @method resetGlobalData * @param {gs.Object_Base} sender - The sender object. * @param {Object} params - Can be null. ### resetGlobalData: (sender) -> GameManager.resetGlobalData() ###* * Action method which saves game settings. * * @method saveSettings * @param {gs.Object_Base} sender - The sender object. * @param {Object} params - Can be null. ### saveSettings: (sender) -> GameManager.saveSettings() ###* * Action method which prepares the game for saving by taking a snapshot of the current game state * and storing it in GameManager.saveGame. * * @method prepareSaveGame * @param {gs.Object_Base} sender - The sender object. * @param {Object} params - Can be null. ### prepareSaveGame: (sender, params) -> GameManager.prepareSaveGame(params?.snapshot) ###* * Action method which saves the current game at the specified save slot. * * @method saveGame * @param {gs.Object_Base} sender - The sender object. * @param {Object} params - Contains the slot-index where the game should be saved. *
    *
  • params.slot - The slot-index where the game should be saved. Can be a binding-expression.
    • *
### saveGame: (sender, params) -> GameManager.save(ui.Component_FormulaHandler.fieldValue(sender, params.slot)) ###* * Action method which loads the game from the specified save slot. * * @method loadGame * @param {gs.Object_Base} sender - The sender object. * @param {Object} params - Contains the slot-index where the game should be loaded from. *
    *
  • params.slot - The slot-index where the game should be loaded from. Can be a binding-expression.
    • *
### loadGame: (sender, params) -> GameManager.tempSettings.skip = no GameManager.load(ui.Component_FormulaHandler.fieldValue(sender, params.slot)) ###* * Action method which starts a new game. * * @method newGame * @param {gs.Object_Base} sender - The sender object. * @param {Object} params - Can be null ### newGame: (sender, params) -> AudioManager.stopAllMusic(30) GameManager.newGame() scene = new vn.Object_Scene() SceneManager.clear() SceneManager.switchTo(scene) ###* * Action method which exists the current game. It doesn't change the scene and * should be called before switching back to the title screen or main menu. * * @method exitGame * @param {gs.Object_Base} sender - The sender object. * @param {Object} params - Can be null ### exitGame: (sender, params) -> GameManager.exitGame() ###* * Action method which switches to another scene. * * @method switchScene * @param {gs.Object_Base} sender - The sender object. * @param {Object} params - Contains the class name of the scene to switch to. *
    *
  • params.name - The class-name of the scene to switch to. The class must be defined in vn-namespace.
    • *
### switchScene: (sender, params) -> f = => if params.clear SceneManager.clear() scene = new vn[params.name]() SceneManager.switchTo(scene, params.savePrevious) if !params.savePrevious @layout.ui.disappear (e) => f() else f() ###* * Action method which switches to another game scene. * * @method switchGameScene * @param {gs.Object_Base} sender - The sender object. * @param {Object} params - Contains the UID of the scene to switch to. *
    *
  • params.uid - The UID of the scene to switch to.
    • *
### switchGameScene: (sender, params) -> f = => if params.clear SceneManager.clear() uid = params.uid if params.name sceneDocuments = DataManager.getDocumentsByType("vn.scene") sceneDocument = sceneDocuments.first (d) -> d.items.name == params.name if sceneDocument uid = sceneDocument.uid sceneData = uid: uid, pictures: [], texts: [] GameManager.sceneData = sceneData newScene = new vn.Object_Scene() newScene.sceneData = sceneData SceneManager.switchTo(newScene, params.savePrevious) if !params.savePrevious @layout.ui.disappear (e) => f() else f() ###* * Action method which switches to another layout. * * @method switchLayout * @param {gs.Object_Base} sender - The sender object. * @param {Object} params - Contains the name of the layout to switch to. *
    *
  • params.name - The name of the layout to switch to.
    • *
  • params.savePrevious - Indicates if the current layout should not be erased but paused and hidden instead so * that it can be restored using returnToPrevious action.
    • *
  • params.dataFields - Defines the data of "$dataFields" binding-expression variable. Can be a binding-expression * or a direct object. Optional.
    • *
### switchLayout: (sender, layout) -> f = => Graphics.freeze() if layout.clear SceneManager.clear() scene = new gs.Object_Layout(layout.name) dataFields = sender.dataFields if typeof layout.dataFields == "string" dataFields = ui.Component_FormulaHandler.fieldValue(sender, layout.dataFields) else if layout.dataFields? dataFields = layout.dataFields scene.dataFields = dataFields scene.controllers = layout.controllers if layout.senderData? for senderField in layout.senderData scene[senderField] = sender[senderField] SceneManager.switchTo(scene, layout.savePrevious, layout.stack) if !layout.savePrevious (@layout||@object.layout).ui.disappear (e) => f() else f() ###* * Action method which returns to previous layout. (If savePrevious was set to true on switchLayout.). * * @method previousLayout * @param {gs.Object_Base} sender - The sender object. * @param {Object} params - Can be null. ### previousLayout: (sender) -> SceneManager.returnToPrevious() ###* * Action method which disposes the specified control. * * @method disposeControl * @param {gs.Object_Base} sender - The sender object. * @param {string} params - The ID of the control to dispose. Can be a binding-expression. ### disposeControl: (sender, id) -> control = @objectManager.objectById(ui.Component_FormulaHandler.fieldValue(sender, id)) control?.ui.disappear (sender) -> sender.dispose() ###* * Action method which creates a new control from the specified descriptor. * * @method createControl * @param {gs.Object_Base} sender - The sender object. * @param {string} params - Contains the descriptor and other data needed to construct the control. *
    *
  • params.descriptor - The control' descriptor. Can be a direct descriptor definition or a template name
    • *
  • params.parent - A binding-expression which returns the control's parent.
    • *
  • params.senderData - An object containing additional data merged into the control object.
    • *
### createControl: (sender, data) -> if typeof data.descriptor == "string" descriptor = ui.UIManager.customTypes[data.descriptor] else descriptor = data.descriptor parent = ui.Component_FormulaHandler.fieldValue(sender, data.parent) control = ui.UiFactory._createFromDescriptor(descriptor, parent ? @object) if data.senderData? for fieldName in data.senderData control[fieldName] = sender[fieldName] control.ui.prepare() control.ui.appear() return control ###* * Action method which quits the game. * * @method quitGame * @param {gs.Object_Base} sender - The sender object. * @param {string} params - Can be null. ### quitGame: (sender, data) -> SceneManager.switchTo(null) gs.Component_LayoutSceneBehavior = Component_LayoutSceneBehavior
